Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "t[NuGet.org Bug]: Intel corp. cannot upload packages since Dec,9 to nuget.org with API" (#8908) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

We use a command:
for f in $(find <path> -name "*.nupkg" ); do echo $f; curl -H 'X-NuGet-ApiKey:<apikey>' -H 'X-NuGet-Protocol-Version: 4.1.0' -f -S --fail https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package -X PUT -F "data=@$f" --ciphers AES256-SHA


The response is:
[12:37] Perestoronin, Andrey
* Trying 52.240.159.111...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to www.nuget.org (52.240.159.111) port 443 (#0)
* ALPN, offering h2
* ALPN, offering http/1.1
* Cipher selection: AES256-SHA
* successfully set certificate verify locations:
* CAfile: /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt
CApath: /etc/ssl/certs
* TLSv1.3 (OUT), TLS handshake, Client hello (1):
* TLSv1.3 (IN), TLS handshake, Server hello (2):
* TLSv1.2 (IN), TLS handshake, Certificate (11):
* TLSv1.2 (IN), TLS handshake, Server finished (14):
* TLSv1.2 (OUT), TLS handshake, Client key exchange (16):
* TLSv1.2 (OUT), TLS change cipher, Client hello (1):
* TLSv1.2 (OUT), TLS handshake, Finished (20):
* TLSv1.2 (IN), TLS handshake, Finished (20):
* SSL connection using TLSv1.2 / AES256-SHA
* ALPN, server did not agree to a protocol
* Server certificate:
* subject: C=US; ST=WA; L=Redmond; O=Microsoft Corporation; CN=*.nuget.org
* start date: Oct 28 04:20:43 2021 GMT
* expire date: Oct 23 04:20:43 2022 GMT
* subjectAltName: host "www.nuget.org" matched cert's "*.nuget.org"
* issuer: C=US; O=Microsoft Corporation; CN=Microsoft Azure TLS Issuing CA 02
* SSL certificate verify ok.
> PUT /api/v2/package HTTP/1.1
> Host: www.nuget.org
> User-Agent: curl/7.58.0
> Accept: */*
> X-NuGet-ApiKey:
> X-NuGet-Protocol-Version: 4.1.0
> Content-Length: 16320443
> Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=------------------------d0cc924f276fc3fd
> Expect: 100-continue
>
< HTTP/1.1 100 Continue
**< HTTP/1.1 201 Created**
< Cache-Control: private, s-maxage=0
< Transfer-Encoding: chunked
< Request-Context: appId=cid-v1:338f6804-b1a9-4fe3-bba7-c93064e7ae7b
< Access-Control-Expose-Headers: Request-Context
< Content-Security-Policy: frame-ancestors 'none'
< X-Frame-Options: deny
< X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
< X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
< Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains
< Set-Cookie: ARRAffinity=a772f7d26114a351ca4c91c481fd64df4c1b791d3577c9c23a1751ba712cdd47;Path=/;HttpOnly;Secure;Domain=nuget-prod-v2gallery-appservice.trafficmanager.net
< Set-Cookie: ARRAffinitySameSite=a772f7d26114a351ca4c91c481fd64df4c1b791d3577c9c23a1751ba712cdd47;Path=/;HttpOnly;SameSite=None;Secure;Domain=nuget-prod-v2gallery-appservice.trafficmanager.net
< Date: Mon, 13 Dec 2021 09:36:35 GMT
<
* Connection #0 to host www.nuget.org left intact

But we don't see the packages on nuget.org yet.
The list pf packages we tried to upload:

onevpl.devel.win-x64.2022.0.0.59.nupkg
onevpl.runtime.win-x64.2022.0.0.59.nupkg
intelipp_crypto.devel.linux-x64.2021.5.0.445.nupkg
intelipp_crypto.devel.linux-x86.2021.5.0.445.nupkg
intelipp_crypto.nonpic.linux-x64.2021.5.0.445.nupkg
intelipp_crypto.nonpic.linux-x86.2021.5.0.445.nupkg
intelipp_crypto.static.linux-x64.2021.5.0.445.nupkg
intelipp_crypto.static.linux-x86.2021.5.0.445.nupkg
intelmpi.devel.win-x64.2021.5.0.474.nupkg
intelmpi.redist.win-x64.2021.5.0.474.nupkg
inteltbb.devel.linux.2021.5.0.707.nupkg
intelmpi.devel.linux-x64.2021.5.0.495.nupkg
intelopenmp.devel.linux.2022.0.0.3623.nupkg
intelopenmp.static.linux.2022.0.0.3623.nupkg
intelopenmp.devel.win.2022.0.0.3663.nupkg
intelopenmp.redist.win.2022.0.0.3663.nupkg
intelipp.devel.win-x64.2021.5.0.528.nupkg
intelipp.devel.win-x86.2021.5.0.528.nupkg
intelipp.redist.win-x64.2021.5.0.528.nupkg
intelipp.redist.win-x86.2021.5.0.528.nupkg
intelipp.static.win-x64.2021.5.0.528.nupkg
intelipp.static.win-x86.2021.5.0.528.nupkg
intelmkl.devel.cluster.win-x64.2022.0.0.115.nupkg
intelmkl.devel.win-x64.2022.0.0.115.nupkg

intelmkl.redist.win-x64.2022.0.0.115.nupkg
intelmkl.redist.win-x86.2022.0.0.115.nupkg
intelmkl.static.cluster.win-x64.2022.0.0.115.nupkg
intelmkl.static.win-x64.2022.0.0.115.nupkg
intelmkl.static.win-x86.2022.0.0.115.nupkg
onednn.cpu_iomp.devel.win-x64.2022.0.0.19.nupkg
onednn.cpu_iomp.redist.win-x64.2022.0.0.19.nupkg
onednn.cpu_tbb.devel.win-x64.2022.0.0.19.nupkg
onednn.cpu_tbb.redist.win-x64.2022.0.0.19.nupkg
onednn.cpu_vcomp.devel.win-x64.2022.0.0.19.nupkg
onednn.cpu_vcomp.redist.win-x64.2022.0.0.19.nupkg
inteldaal.devel.win-x64.2021.5.0.796.nupkg
inteldaal.redist.win-x64.2021.5.0.796.nupkg
inteldaal.static.win-x64.2021.5.0.796.nupkg
inteldal.devel.win-x64.2021.5.0.796.nupkg
inteldal.redist.win-x64.2021.5.0.796.nupkg
inteldal.static.win-x64.2021.5.0.796.nupkg
inteltbb.devel.win.2021.5.0.714.nupkg
inteltbb.redist.win.2021.5.0.714.nupkg


Intel Corp.



### Repro Steps

- Call https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package api
- expect to see packages on https://www.nuget.org/

### Expected Behavior

to see packages on https://www.nuget.org/

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Spike] Spec AVERT client v2" (#8909) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: We're moving to a v2 client based on more complete specs.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[online safety] Add communication workflow to support playbook for package safety report " (#8563) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Never remembers my account" (#8907) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

The problematic device - Ipad on 14.4 IpadOS. On my Windows laptop it works fine.

1. I fill in my MSFT Account
2. It then sends me a verification email
3. I confirm and check "Never ask again on this device"
4. I check "Never log out on this device" (or something, it's unfortunately localised)

Now, within less than a day it completely forgets my account.

### Repro Steps

See Describe the bug

### Expected Behavior

Expected - it won't log out me at all.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedBody:

`dotnet list package --vulnerable` shoud return non-zero status code when issues are found.

The the CI could break build when problems are found.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: nuget 6 not including native file " (#11431) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

6.0.0.280

### Worked before?

5.11.0.10

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

I am trying to wrap into a nuget package some native c++ code, using the following nuspec file

```
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<package >
    <metadata>
        <id>PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default</id>
        <version>0.0.0</version>
        <description>NA</description>
		<authors> Vincenzo Ferrazzano</authors>
        <tags>native Native nativepackage C++ binaries vc142</tags>
        <dependencies>
            <dependency id="Google.Protobuf_v142" version="3.17.3" />
        </dependencies>
    </metadata>
    <files>
		<file src="./pb_api/mpg2axioma_api/mpg2axioma_cpp/x64/Debug/*.pdb"                  target="build/native/lib/x64/v142/Debug/"     />
        <file src="./pb_api/mpg2axioma_api/mpg2axioma_cpp/x64/Debug/*.lib"     	            target="build/native/lib/x64/v142/Debug/"  />
		<file src="./pb_api/mpg2axioma_api/mpg2axioma_cpp/x64/Release/*.pdb"       		    target="build/native/lib/x64/v142/Release/"     />
        <file src="./pb_api/mpg2axioma_api/mpg2axioma_cpp/x64/Release/*.lib"     	        target="build/native/lib/x64/v142/Release/"  />
        <file src="./pb_api/mpg2axioma_api/mpg2axioma_cpp/src/*.h"  	                    target="build/native/include" />
        <file src="PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default.props"   					target="build" />
        <file src="./pb_api/mpg2axioma_api/mpg2axioma.proto"   					          target="build" />
    </files>
</package>
```

All the files are existing and correcly located. 
I have noticed that the new version of nuget does not include the native files, while the version 5 did.
See attached logs

### Verbose Logs

```shell
*****Previous version******

PS C:\sw_source\PVIM_protobuffer> ./nuget5.exe pack  PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default.nuspec -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 5.11.0.10
Attempting to build package from 'PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default.nuspec'.

Id: PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default
Version: 0.0.0
Authors: Vincenzo Ferrazzano
Description: Native Protobuffer API for the Poste Vita Internal Model
Tags: native, Native, nativepackage, C++, binaries, vc142
Dependencies: Google.Protobuf_v142 [3.17.3, )

Added file '[Content_Types].xml'.
Added file '_rels/.rels'.
Added file 'build/mpg2axioma.proto'.
Added file 'build/native/include/mpg2axioma.pb.h'.
Added file 'build/native/lib/x64/v142/Debug/mpg2axioma_cpp_api.lib'.
Added file 'build/native/lib/x64/v142/Debug/mpg2axioma_cpp_api.pdb'.
Added file 'build/native/lib/x64/v142/Release/mpg2axioma_cpp_api.lib'.
Added file 'build/native/lib/x64/v142/Release/mpg2axioma_cpp_api.pdb'.
Added file 'build/PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default.props'.
Added file 'package/services/metadata/core-properties/7cb4d1c3e2bc43a4b1261b682f210a6d.psmdcp'.
Added file 'PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default.nuspec'.

Successfully created package 'C:\sw_source\PVIM_protobuffer\PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default.0.0.0.nupkg'.

*****current version******

PS C:\sw_source\PVIM_protobuffer> ./nuget6.exe pack  PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default.nuspec -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 6.0.0.280
Attempting to build package from 'PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default.nuspec'.

Added file '_rels/.rels'.
Added file 'build/mpg2axioma.proto'.
Added file 'build/PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default.props'.
Added file 'package/services/metadata/core-properties/5b29d9121f74494a85d60b4910551a10.psmdcp'.
Added file 'PVIM.ProtoBufferApi_v142_default.nuspec'.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: After adding key via `nuget setApiKey`, push commands error with `Key not valid for use in specified state.` & exit with code 1" (#11428) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

5.11.0.10

### Worked before?

Worked before a machine reload, so I have to assume the problem is more with setApiKey than with push perhaps?

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

1. generate an api key at nuget.org
2. `nuget setApiKey {key} -source nuget.org`
3. `nuget.exe push {package} -NonInteractive -Source nuget.org -Timeout 300 -SkipDuplicate`
4. process exits with code 1 and an error about the key state

### Verbose Logs

```shell
‚ûú nuget.exe push .\.release-packages\PeanutButter.XmlUtils.2.0.50.nupkg -NonInteractive -SOurce nuget.org -Timeout 300 -SkipDuplicate -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 5.4.0.6315
Pushing PeanutButter.XmlUtils.2.0.50.nupkg to 'https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package'...
  PUT https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/
  Conflict https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/ 7430ms
Package 'C:\code\opensource\PeanutButter\.\.release-packages\PeanutButter.XmlUtils.2.0.50.nupkg' already exists at feed 'https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package'.
Key not valid for use in specified state.
System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException: Key not valid for use in specified state.

   at System.Security.Cryptography.ProtectedData.Unprotect(Byte[] encryptedData, Byte[] optionalEntropy, DataProtectionScope scope)
   at NuGet.Configuration.EncryptionUtility.DecryptString(String encryptedString)
   at NuGet.Configuration.SettingsUtility.GetDecryptedValueForAddItem(ISettings settings, String section, String key, Boolean isPath)
   at NuGet.Commands.CommandRunnerUtility.GetApiKey(ISettings settings, String endpoint, String source, String defaultApiKey, Boolean isSymbolApiKey)
   at NuGet.Commands.PushRunner.<>c__DisplayClass0_0.<Run>b__1(String symbolsEndpoint)
   at NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.PackageUpdateResource.<Push>d__14.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at NuGet.Commands.PushRunner.<Run>d__0.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.PushCommand.<ExecuteCommandAsync>d__36.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Command.Execute()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Program.MainCore(String workingDirectory, String[] args)
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: The ‚Äúversion‚Äù drop-down box shows the installed version instead of latest version in Browse tab before refreshing" (#11461) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

NuGet Client Dev\6.1.0.83

### Worked before?

No

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Details about Problem
VS Version: Main\32016.83
NuGet Version: Dev\6.1.0.83
OS Version: Windows-11-Enterprise-21H2
#### Repro steps
1. Create a C# Console App (.NET 6.0) project.
2. Open the PM UI for the project and go to Browse tab.
3. Install a package ‚Äì not the latest version (e.g. Newtonsoft.Json) from Browse tab.
4. Observe the ‚Äúversion‚Äù drop-down box on the right panel after installing.
#### Expected
The ‚Äúversion‚Äù drop-down box should show the latest version of this package in Browse tab.
#### Actual
The ‚Äúversion‚Äù drop-down box shows the installed version instead of latest version in Browse tab as below.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/146527400-7a9c373f-fb08-4bb7-b630-e21b42e669e4.png)
#### Notes
1. The ‚Äúversion‚Äù drop-down box will show the latest version of this package correctly after refreshing/reopening the PM UI/switching the tab back as below.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/146528463-57ffa97d-63b0-438d-ba8c-cad6e2e05dc6.png)
2. It is not a regression issue since it reproes on D16.10 31025.218.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_
